title: World
description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.

items.title: Vice President Harris is going to Poland after the U.S. rejected fighter jet offer
items.content_html: Poland offered to stage fighter jets for Ukraine on a U.S. base in Germany. The Pentagon said that wasn't tenable. It all happened the day before Vice President Harris left for Warsaw.
items.summary: Poland offered to stage fighter jets for Ukraine on a U.S. base in Germany. The Pentagon said that wasn't tenable. It all happened the day before Vice President Harris left for Warsaw.

items.title: Ukraine's libraries are offering bomb shelters, camouflage classes, and yes, books
items.content_html: One bundle of homemade camouflage netting was packaged with a note reading, "Death to enemies." The libraries are also sending Ukrainian books out of the country, to refugees who have fled.
items.summary: One bundle of homemade camouflage netting was packaged with a note reading, "Death to enemies." The libraries are also sending Ukrainian books out of the country, to refugees who have fled.

items.title: The war in Ukraine has derailed one American family's adoption plan
items.content_html: The Bell family has been trying to adopt Vanya and Serogzha from Ukraine for about two years.
items.summary: The Bell family has been trying to adopt Vanya and Serogzha from Ukraine for about two years.

items.title: WHO Africa's 1st woman leader helps continent fight COVID
items.content_html: Dr. Matshidiso Moeti has become one of the world's most compelling voices urging better consideration of Africa's people — especially women.
items.summary: Dr. Matshidiso Moeti has become one of the world's most compelling voices urging better consideration of Africa's people — especially women.

items.title: Venezuela releases 2 Americans after visit from U.S. officials
items.content_html: A high-level delegation traveled to the South American country last weekend to in part discuss the health of detained U.S. citizens.
items.summary: A high-level delegation traveled to the South American country last weekend to in part discuss the health of detained U.S. citizens.

items.title: Sex abuse lawsuit against Prince Andrew has been formally dismissed by a judge
items.content_html: Lawyers revealed three weeks ago that they had tentatively agreed to a settlement in which the prince would donate to Virginia Giuffre's charity and declare he didn't intend to malign her character.
items.summary: Lawyers revealed three weeks ago that they had tentatively agreed to a settlement in which the prince would donate to Virginia Giuffre's charity and declare he didn't intend to malign her character.

items.title: Russia-Ukraine war: What happened today (March 8)
items.content_html: A roundup of key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
items.summary: A roundup of key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

items.title: Ukrainian athletes are dominating the Paralympics, despite the uncertainty at home
items.content_html: They swept the podium in two separate biathlon events on Tuesday and are second in the medal count. But the troubles at home are never far from their minds.
items.summary: They swept the podium in two separate biathlon events on Tuesday and are second in the medal count. But the troubles at home are never far from their minds.

items.title: McDonald's, Coca-Cola, PepsiCo and Starbucks join a corporate exodus from Russia
items.content_html: The big American companies are the latest to suspend their operations in the wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
items.summary: The big American companies are the latest to suspend their operations in the wake of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

items.title: A rescue team evacuates premature American twins from Kyiv in a daring mission
items.content_html: The twin boys, Lenny and Moishe, were born just as Russia invaded Ukraine. A specialist team of U.S. Army veterans hatched a desperate plan to bring them into Poland and, hopefully, to safety.
items.summary: The twin boys, Lenny and Moishe, were born just as Russia invaded Ukraine. A specialist team of U.S. Army veterans hatched a desperate plan to bring them into Poland and, hopefully, to safety.

items.title: More than 2 million people have fled Ukraine, 12 days after Russia invaded
items.content_html: The number of refugees has has increased exponentially in the last few days as Russian forces amped up their shelling of critical and civilian infrastructure.
items.summary: The number of refugees has has increased exponentially in the last few days as Russian forces amped up their shelling of critical and civilian infrastructure.

items.title: Stalled and frustrated, Putin will likely 'double down' in the coming weeks, CIA says
items.content_html: CIA Director William Burns says Russia's invasion of Ukraine has fallen far short of Vladimir Putin's expectations. Burns now predicts weeks of "ugly" fighting for control of Ukraine's cities.
items.summary: CIA Director William Burns says Russia's invasion of Ukraine has fallen far short of Vladimir Putin's expectations. Burns now predicts weeks of "ugly" fighting for control of Ukraine's cities.

items.title: Yo-Yo Ma performs a musical protest outside the Russian Embassy
items.content_html: The world-famous cellist made a personal stand with Ukraine on Monday, setting up his instrument on the sidewalk in Washington, D.C., next to an improvised street sign reading, "Zelensky Way."
items.summary: The world-famous cellist made a personal stand with Ukraine on Monday, setting up his instrument on the sidewalk in Washington, D.C., next to an improvised street sign reading, "Zelensky Way."

items.title: Some of Ukraine's Orthodox churches want to break away from their Russian patriarch
items.content_html: At church, Ukrainians pray for an end to war. But a rift is forming: The head of the Russian Orthodox Church has defended Moscow's invasion. Some in Ukraine want to break away from his leadership.
items.summary: At church, Ukrainians pray for an end to war. But a rift is forming: The head of the Russian Orthodox Church has defended Moscow's invasion. Some in Ukraine want to break away from his leadership.

items.title: As South Koreans go to the polls, a backlash against feminism has become political
items.content_html: Young voters are considered a key voting bloc as the ruling Democratic Party and the conservative opposition People Power Party vie to secure the presidency. But gender issues divide South Koreans.
items.summary: Young voters are considered a key voting bloc as the ruling Democratic Party and the conservative opposition People Power Party vie to secure the presidency. But gender issues divide South Koreans.

items.title: Biden announces Russian oil import ban and warns gas prices could increase even more
items.content_html: President Biden described the move as a critical step to punishing Russian President Vladimir Putin for invading Ukraine, but said as a result, Americans should prepare for price hikes at the pump.
items.summary: President Biden described the move as a critical step to punishing Russian President Vladimir Putin for invading Ukraine, but said as a result, Americans should prepare for price hikes at the pump.

items.title: How sanctions are pinning down the Russian economy
items.content_html: The Russian economy is cratering under the weight of Western sanctions. Russian policymakers are struggling with how to respond — and what to wear.
items.summary: The Russian economy is cratering under the weight of Western sanctions. Russian policymakers are struggling with how to respond — and what to wear.

items.title: Russia's invasion puts a new light on Trump's Ukraine pressure campaign
items.content_html: With Russia's brutal invasion and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy being hailed as a hero, Trump's infamous 2019 call to Zelenskyy is put into a very different light.
items.summary: With Russia's brutal invasion and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy being hailed as a hero, Trump's infamous 2019 call to Zelenskyy is put into a very different light.
